title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman calls India a potential full-stack AI leader ahead of India AI Summit
description: As India prepares to host a major global AI summit, OpenAI chief Sam Altman says the country has the people, scale and ambition needed to build artificial intelligence, not just use it.
content: As New Delhi gets ready to host the India AI Impact Summit, OpenAI chief Sam Altman has placed India at the centre of a global conversation about who will actually build the next wave of artificial intelligence. In comments released ahead of the summ... [2985 chars]

title: Can AI bully humans? Bot publicly criticises engineer after code rejection
description: Bullying has long existed in schools, offices, and online spaces. Shockingly, the debate has entered the world of artificial intelligence. A recent incident reported has raised fresh AI safety...
content: Bullying has long existed in schools, offices, and online spaces. Shockingly, the debate has entered the world of artificial intelligence. A recent incident reported has raised fresh AI safety concerns after an autonomous AI agent publicly criticised... [2156 chars]

title: AI adoption leading to moderation in entry-level hiring: Report
description: NEW DELHI, Feb 15:  Artificial Intelligence (AI) adoption has led firms to moderate hiring, primarily at the entry-level, according to a report. According to a study by the Indian Council for Research on International Economic Relations (ICRIER) supported by OpenAI, AI adoption is reshaping hiring priorities across the sector. The study finds that 63 per cent of firms reported increased demand for candidates with domain expertise and AI or data skills, pointing to a growing premium on hybrid skill sets […]
content:

title: Abhishek Bachchan cautions actors on unchecked use of AI, says it scares him
description: At the ET NOW Global Business Summit 2026, Abhishek Bachchan expresses his worries about the rapid rise of artificial intelligence, highlighting its potential risks for actors and wider disruption across sectors.
content: As artificial intelligence continues to make rapid inroads into creative industries, Abhishek Bachchan has sounded a note of caution, warning that its unchecked use could pose serious risks for performers. Speaking at the ET NOW Global Business Summi... [1952 chars]

title: AI must be human-centric; democratic in tech access: IT Secy ahead of mega summit
description: India is preparing to host the AI Impact Summit 2026. The nation's key message is that artificial intelligence must be human-centric and inclusive. IT Secretary S Krishnan stated that AI should drive global economic growth, benefiting all regions. The summit will foster discussions on AI governance, safety, and economic progress.
content:

title: India plans AI-focused data city in Visakhapatnam to attract global investment
description: India is betting big on artificial intelligence, and a quiet port city on the east coast is being lined up to carry that ambition, with billions in investment, massive data centres and a plan that goes far beyond servers and cables.
content: For decades, Visakhapatnam has lived a quieter life on India’s east coast. It is a naval town, a port city, a place better known for hosting international cricket matches than creating the future of global technology. That is now changing. Andhra Pra... [4950 chars]

title: ‘Six gigawatts and counting’: Nara Lokesh’s data city vision aims to redefine India’s tech landscape
description: Andhra Pradesh is planning a ‘data city’ in Visakhapatnam, aiming to anchor India’s artificial intelligence ambitions with multibillion-dollar investments, submarine cable links and six gigawatts of data centre capacity as New Delhi pushes to narrow the AI gap with the US and China.
content:
As India races to narrow the artificial intelligence gap with the United States and China, it is planning a vast new “data city” to power digital growth on a staggering scale, the man spearheading the project says.
“The AI revolution is here, no seco... [4223 chars]

title: Kerala launches massive AI literacy drive targeting 6 lakh parents
description: Thiruvananthapuram, Feb 15 (PTI) Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education (KITE), the technical arm of the state General Education Department, has launched a massive artificial intelligence literacy drive targeting the adult population. Titled ‘Sarvam AI Mayam’ (AI is Everywhere), the initiative is considered as the largest such artificial intelligence awareness programme to be implemented in […]
content:
The programme, which is scheduled to run until June 30, 2026, is being implemented across 2,200 Little KITEs units, with each unit training an average of 300 parents, it said.
The two-hour training module is designed to give equal importance to both ... [2204 chars]

title: Global tech leaders look forward to being in India for AI Impact Summit
description: India is set to take center stage in the global artificial intelligence (AI) landscape as it welcomes world leaders, industry executives, and academic experts for the upcoming AI Impact Summit in New Delhi. The summit aims to chart a path for responsible, inclusive, and scalable AI adoption.
